hobby.message: Analog photography still treating you right?
Urban exploring with that homebrew again?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Still breathing, with a couple extra filters in place.
Keeps me busy, this city. Got a knack for odd hobbies.
Utility tunnels are quieter than street level lately.
Some nights, even the tunnels feel crowded, thanks to recent chaos.
Breathing, with one eye open. Old habits.
Urban exploring keeps me sane—tunnels, sealed data centers, off-grid nooks.
Everybody’s jumpy since those so-called ‘ghosts’ showed up.
Saw signs of visitors where I’m used to being alone.
Now I leave fewer footprints than I used to.
As long as Stenograd’s got power, I’ll keep exploring what’s left underneath.
Urban exploration—tunnels, abandoned substations, the whole underbelly. That’s my therapy.
Had a run-in with some of those ‘ghost’ folks down there last week.
The city feels different when the missing start showing up off the grid.
No digital trail, no BCI pings—just boots and echoes.
Makes a guy mindful where he steps, these days.
Still breathing, mostly underground. Better insulation from city gossip.
I’d rather wander forgotten server rooms than line up for rationed coffee.
Lately, hobby’s got complicated—those ‘erased’ folks keep cropping up down tunnels.
Crossed paths just last night: no tags, no records, made me question my memory.
I keep separate paper notes now, just to be sure what’s real.
Odd comfort in knowing the ghosts are as out of place as me.
Used to be, the only thing haunting tunnels was the plumbing.
Still here, Alex. Just survived another crawl through the old Sector 9 lines.
Urban exploring’s my thing—sealed tunnels, abandoned hubs, places the BCI forgot.
Started back when I left state work—needed space, got hooked by the quiet.
Now with the ‘ghost’ returns, I run into people who don’t officially exist downtown.
Ran smack into them last week—a little too real for comfort.
We traded looks, not words. City’s systems didn’t even notice.
These days I log routes on paper—digital records can’t be trusted anymore.
Funny how my hobby went from escape to front-row seat for all the city’s glitches.
hobby_answer: Yeah, a few shadows.
Tunnels are emptier, though. People keep their heads down lately.
Some old doors are unlocked now—guess someone forgot.
Wouldn’t say it’s safer.
Everything’s weird after those BCI leaks.
Seen something close enough to ghosts.
Lot of strangers down there now, not regulars.
Had to skip a few favorite spots—too unpredictable since the reappearances.
Manual logs only, can’t trust system records.
Heard noises no sensor would catch recently.
Hard to tell who’s watching anymore.
Yeah, ran into three last week—didn’t expect company.
Used to be just bored engineers or squatters—now it’s folks the city erased.
Access is completely different since the BCI glitches.
Re-mapped a couple tunnels by hand, just to be sure.
Can’t rely on digital keys: logs go missing, doors open and shut themselves.
Not as relaxing as it used to be lately.
Still, habit’s hard to break.
Sure did. Nearly walked into a group not even showing on scanners.
Used to know every regular down there. Now, half are ghosts or fresh faces.
BCI mess-up dumped a bunch of forgotten folks into places they shouldn’t be.
Manual notes are the only way I can track if I went somewhere or not.
Had to turn clients down, too risky to get flagged by association.
Honestly, part of me envies their freedom. No trackers, no worries—at least for now.
But the rest of us still get scored for what’s outside our control.
I duck out earlier these days, keep it short.
Ghosts, all right. Ran into three last Thursday—first time I genuinely hesitated.
Back when I started, all I worried about was unstable power lines. Now it’s city politics under my boots.
Ever since Halden died and those profiles got restored, tunnels fill with the erased. Quiet, lost, mostly keep to themselves.
I used to log routes digitally for fun. Now I only trust paper—can’t risk my score fluctuating just for a walk.
System missed my entry twice last week. Could be a blessing or a trap.
Turned down a dozen side jobs—rumors fly that ghost contact drops points.
On edge because Directorate blames 'faulty infrastructure' but I know it’s the system chasing its tail.
Still find beauty in the old relay rooms—especially now, when it all might vanish.
Funny thing: underground feels more honest than upstairs, even with the ghosts.
